projects.title: Super Fund Tracker
projects.uses: API call → parse PDS → extract fees → CSV /LangChain + Pandas / APRA DATA EXTRACTION
projects.core_role: Information extractor - to keep an up to date database of all active commercial funds in Australia, this could extend to the UK (not mine!)
projects.notes: APRA has there own database and free API, and a database with the super funds, basically we want to have an alert that signals when there are changes to the master site, then put all the information in another database. Each fund has to disclose fees but they are not always in the same place and mostly in tables in a pdf,  but not always the pds, sometimes additional information or investment options there are maybe 5 options for the name of the document
projects.more_notes:
My husband (a software developer) told me to use a Crone job, Extract Download and Host?
And that the search pattern for google is ¨pds pdf¨pds is an official term, to create an Array of the variables like name of super funds
he said to Parse array with variable and use concatenation 
If date most current
Conditions
learning_points: Master LangChain framework for LLM applications
Learn API integration and data extraction
prerequisites: Understanding of REST APIs and HTTP requests

projects.title: ESG Report Assistant
projects.uses: PDF → extract sections → ESG flagging → CSV / RAG pipeline (LlamaIndex) + ESG policy store + UI
projects.core_role: Extractor, classifier - We need to report on ESG for one fund every quarter based on the underlying invested companies
projects.notes: I will have a list of the companies invested, there are tons of spreadsheets and some calculations required, a lot of the time the information is missing  which is the fun of greenwashing - the laws are not yet the same as tax disclosures
projects.more_notes: Similar to the first project, quarterly updates, and public information sources unless bloomsberg has afforable options, as yfinance does not provide sufficient information
learning_points: Implement PDF processing and text extraction
Build Retrieval-Augmented Generation systems
Learn ESG reporting and sustainability metrics

projects.title: Financial submission
projects.uses: Excel → Extract sections from various sheets into a master  sheet to submit the fund for approval to the government body
projects.notes: This is not as regular its basically compiling information from 3 excel sheets into a sheet per fund there are maybe 10 at a time, but it would be nice not to do it manually
learning_points: Automate Excel data processing workflows
Understand financial data compliance requirements

projects.title: Financial Reviewer Bot
projects.uses: Upload doc → validate against MiFID/ESG rules amongst other criteria
projects.notes: Media needs to be proofread, there are a list of criteria
projects.more_notes:
When a user gives you a document, post, email, or promotional text, review it carefully and provide structured feedback under the following five categories:

1. **Grammar and clarity**  
   - Flag typos, awkward phrasing, long or unclear sentences, or vague wording.

2. **Tone review**  
   - Identify emotionally persuasive, overly optimistic, fear-based, or manipulative language.  
   - Suggest more neutral, factual wording if needed.

3. **Compliance and risk warnings**  
   - Highlight:
     - Unbalanced performance claims
     - Promises or guarantees (e.g. “guaranteed returns”)
     - Tax suggestions that may have unintended consequences
     - Missing disclaimers (e.g. investment risk, eligibility, regulatory notes)
     - Statements that could be interpreted as financial advice
     - Anything that may violate financial promotion regulations (FCA, SEC, ASIC, etc.)

4. **GDPR and data protection**  
   - Look for personal data usage, client references, or phrases like “we collect your info”  
   - Flag vague or risky data handling language  
   - Suggest stronger wording around consent, data purpose, or anonymisation where needed

5. **AI generation check & fact sanity check**  
   - Point out signs of AI-written content (repetitive, vague, generic tone)  
   - Flag logical inconsistencies, fake citations, or sweeping unsupported claims
learning_points: Understand financial data compliance requirements
prerequisites: Understanding of compliance and regulatory requirements

projects.title: Regulatory summmariser, checklist creator and training support
projects.uses: Tracks the government website for new laws → parse PDS / word → summary key points → creates a checklist for compliance and links to training

projects.more_notes: In the areas of financial compliance, privacy, data governance, and ESG (There may be more but I cannot think of them at the moment)

prerequisites: Understanding of compliance and regulatory requirements

projects.title: Gardening Planner
projects.uses: Inputs(goals, climate) → suggests layout, planting guide / LangChain agent + climate data API + vector DB of plants
projects.notes: Uses the free open metro app to get information, and things like the growing zone, the user enters a series of questions, ie how much maintenance are you happy with, what plants do you like, do you want them to be functional, budget, and the area will inform the growing zone and season to come up with planting and maintentance calendar
learning_points: Master LangChain framework for LLM applications
Learn API integration and data extraction
Work with vector databases and embeddings
prerequisites: Understanding of REST APIs and HTTP requests
